docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 20 -- With Dr. John A. Mackay, president of Princeton Theological Seminary, as guest speaker, a conference of Protestant leaders from all over Latin America has begun here a discussion of Protestantism's role and of the religious...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 20 -- With Dr. John A. Mackay, president of Princeton Theological Seminary, as guest speaker, a conference of Protestant leaders from all over Latin America has begun here a discussion of Protestantism's role and of the religious situation in general in all countries south of the Rio Grande.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 25 -- President Juan Peron called tonight for a purge and reorganization of the party that bears his name. He addressed an unprecedented meeting of 6,000 delegates and told them that present-day opposition stemmed from the old...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 25 -- President Juan Peron called tonight for a purge and reorganization of the party that bears his name. He addressed an unprecedented meeting of 6,000 delegates and told them that present-day opposition stemmed from the old Union Democratica, which, he said, had been "formed, directed and paid for" by former Ambassador Spruille Braden.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 30 -- The purge of the peronista party, foreshadowed by President Juan D. Peron in opening the party's national convention last Monday, began yesterday, when former Governor Waldino Suarez of Santa Fe Province was arrested on a...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 30 -- The purge of the peronista party, foreshadowed by President Juan D. Peron in opening the party's national convention last Monday, began yesterday, when former Governor Waldino Suarez of Santa Fe Province was arrested on a train near the border of the Territory of the Chaco.

docs.snippet: Pound sterling moved erratically last week as the financial horizon continued overcast with uncertainties. The setback in "governments'' on the London Stock Exchange to the lowest in a decade, and corresponding weakness in stocks, had a distinctly...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pound sterling moved erratically last week as the financial horizon continued overcast with uncertainties. The setback in "governments'' on the London Stock Exchange to the lowest in a decade, and corresponding weakness in stocks, had a distinctly bearish effect upon the British unit.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended July 29, 1949.
